div.h1: Ukraine-Russia invasion: Germany offers ‘massive support’ for influx of refugees into eastern Europe

a.title: the independent logo

div.p: Germany has offered to support countries in eastern Europe who are facing an influx of refugees coming from Ukraine, Interior Minister Nancy Faeser said on Thursday.
“We will offer massive support to the affected states especially our neighbour Poland in the event of large refugee movements,” Ms Faeser said in a statement.
She added that security authorities in Germany had stepped up protective measures against possible cyber attacks from Russia.
Poland too has said that it is drafting plans to deal with up to one million refugees.
Sign up to our free newsletters by clicking here

From news to politics, travel to sport, culture to climate – The Independent has a host of free newsletters to suit your interests. To find the stories you want to read, and more, in your inbox, click here.

a.span: Stolen car flips off embankment and lands on house in New Jersey
A stolen car flipped off embankment and landed on a house in New Jersey. The driver managed to free himself from the wreckage and ran on foot before being apprehended.Source: Verona Police Department

a.title: Extinction Rebellion shift away from 'disruption' tactics in response to losing public support

img.alt: Extinction Rebellion shift away from 'disruption' tactics in response to losing public support
img.title: Extinction Rebellion shift away from 'disruption' tactics in response to losing public support - Provided by The Independent

a.span: Extinction Rebellion shift away from 'disruption' tactics in response to losing public support

Media Coordinator at Extinction Rebellion Marijn van de Geer has claimed climate protest group Extinction Rebellion is 'temporarily shift away from public disruption' as a tactic to highlight its cause. Source: Good Morning Britain, ITV

a.title: Health secretary blames NHS pressures on flu, Covid and Strep A fears

img.alt: Health secretary blames NHS pressures on flu, Covid and Strep A fears
img.title: Health secretary blames NHS pressures on flu, Covid and Strep A fears - Provided by The Independent

a.span: Health secretary blames NHS pressures on flu, Covid and Strep A fears

The health secretary has blamed high numbers of flu cases, Covid-19 and Strep A fears for the particular pressures the NHS faced over Christmas.Steve Barclay’s comments come as senior doctors say the NHS is on a knife edge, with many A&E units struggling to keep up with demand and trusts and ambulance services declaring critical incidents."There have been particular pressures over Christmas because we've had a surge in flu cases, Covid cases and a lot of concern around Strep A," he said.
